intro: Critesion arizonicum, commonly known as the Arizona milkweed, is a flowering plant native to the southwestern United States. It is characterized by its slender, branched stems and clusters of small, pale yellow flowers. The plant produces a milky sap, which is a common feature among plants in the milkweed family. It thrives in arid and semi-arid environments, often found in desert regions. Critesion arizonicum plays an important role in supporting local pollinators, including butterflies and bees.
